result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Janier A Fajardo Herrera

records.addlTxt: Saul Arteaga

Defendant Janier A Fajardo Herrera in court with the assistance of Spanish Interpreter, Saul Arteaga.  Attorney Mackenzie Renner in court for Janier A Fajardo Herrera.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Samuel Berg. Called @ 1:50 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for 6th status on 22CF90, 8th status on 21CM66, and 6th status on 22CM36.  Record by Atty. Renner that she was just appointed and needs to get discovery. Response by the Court as to age of cases and number of statuses already. Court will grant one more status, but matters will be put on the trial calendar if they are not resolved. Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery

Defendant Janier A Fajardo Herrera in court with the assistance of Spanish Interpreter, Sarah St. John. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by ADA Andrew Herrmann. Attorney Renner from Public Defender's Office appears specially at Court's request. Matter before the Court for status to see if new attorney has been appointed as to all files - 22CF90, 22CM36, 21CM666. Record by Atty. Renner who indicates their office will need about 30 days to get attorney appointed. Court sets all matters out for 60 days so attorney can appear.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Saul Arteaga

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Janier A Fajardo Herrera in court. Attorney Uzowulu appeared specially. Interpreter Arteaga previously sworn. SPD is working on appointing. Will have attorney by next court date. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.
Sarah St  John

Order for Protection

St. John

2:00pm Court in session

Deft does not appear. Attorney Leah Selmek appeared. Zeke Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn interpreter Sarah St. John present in court. 
Atty Selmek is not sure if Deft had transportation for today's hearing. 
Atty Selmek asks that we wait & see if Deft shows up.
Court only has until 2:30pm today

2:14pm Deft now present. 

Matter before the Court is for the State's motion for protective order. 
Defense is objecting, no further argument by Atty Selmek. 

Based on Marsy's law & statute, Court grants the State's order.
State to prepare order. 


2:16pm Court in recess
Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Motion hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Matter not called - all files, (22CF90, 21CM666, and 22CM66) set before Judge Drettwan on March 16, 2022 on Motion for Protective Order. Hearing dates from today should have been removed from the calendar.

St. John

3:46pm Court in session

Defendant Janier A Fajardo Herrera appeared in court with interpreter Sarah St. John & attorney Leah Selmek, Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over.
Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
St. John

Defendant Janier A Fajardo Herrera in court with attorney Leah Selmek.  J J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. St. John previously sworn by Clerk.   Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Rights given and hearing requested, within time period. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Notice of Arrest
Arteaga

BOND TO COVER 22GF132, 21CM666 & 22CM36
No unsupervised contact with minors. No physical discipline. 

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.   Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT A.D.F. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. 

22-650 & 22-651

Defendant in custody, in court by video with Interpreter Saul Arteaga and Attorney Leah Selmek. Vivian TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does qualify for SPD attorney. Defendant has lengthy criminal history. Defendant's cousin is present in Court. Minutes filed.
